alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 07 at 3:58AM AKST until February 08 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously wind chills to 65 below, and blowing snow with reduced visibility occuring. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Southeastern Brooks Range Passes. * WHEN...Now to 6 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds gusting to 40 mph are causing blowing and drifting snow with low visibility and dangerously cold wind chills. Large snow drifts will form. These conditions will continue into Monday, and could possibly extend into Tuesday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
